attributes.action: Call a General Election before any second referendum on Brexit
attributes.additional_details:
The Constitution has been circumvented once too often by both Labour and Conservative governments.
Constitutional Law is clear on any changes to the agreement of governance between the Crown and the people, before any changes can be made to the Constitution, government must first seek consultation with the people before any debate is held in parliament either by general election or referendum, the people no longer trust this parliament to honour the will of the people, call a general election
attributes.background: Parliament opposes the democratic decision of the 2016 referendum, it was made clear at the time that there would be no second referendum, yet MPs have made it clear they are against the will of the people, let the people decide which party is fit to govern.
